intro: Begonia foxworthyi, commonly known as the Foxworth's begonia, is a rare and striking plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its velvety, dark green foliage and clusters of vibrant red and orange tubular flowers. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Its unique floral structure is adapted for pollination by specific insect species, enhancing its ecological significance. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a valuable subject for botanical research and conservation efforts.
